messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/api.php`, I found that `App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\UserPostController@index` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/v1/users/{user}/posts`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/api.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\UserPostController@index`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
- app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/UserPostController.php

Explanation:
- The routes/api.php file wires the route /v1/users/{user}/posts to App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\UserPostController@index, which is implemented in the file above.
- The index method signature is public function index(Request $request, User $user): ResourceCollection.
- The implementation returns a paginated collection of the userâ€™s posts, specifically:
  - It uses the Eloquent relation $user->posts() to fetch the posts.
  - Orders them with latest().
  - Paginates with a limit from the request (default 20): paginate($request->input('limit', 20)).
  - Wraps the results in PostResource::collection(...) for API formatting.

Note:
- The response formatting relies on App\Http\Resources\Post, aliased as PostResource in this controller file.
- If you need to inspect how the posts are related to the user or how the Post resource formats the data, you can also review:
  - app/Models/User.php (for the posts() relationship)
  - app/Http/Resources/Post.php (for the PostResource formatting)
